Message.Title: go back and read my post..."How to play earnings..."
Message.Msg: Earnings are on 18 April. MONTHLY AprIl option expiration is 19 April. PLay the following week's options using money through the sale of a Jan 2014 covered call...buy both the near term call and put at the market price on 18 April...

Message.Title: ER on the 18th
Message.Msg: ER is always a great opportunity. Goog moves $5 to $20 on normal days. The potential post earnings move is incredible. Past two ER's saw the stock move $50.00 overnight. I wouldn't be surprised to see this move $50 to $80 this time. Deep out of the money strangles, and a near the money strangle combo makes sense. Good luck to all who roll the dice for the report.
I"ve seen it move up and down $50 on two separate occasions...however, MONTHLY OPTION EXPIRATION will be a big factor the following day. I have also seen a DELAYED REACTION until the following day

Yes, sir I agree with you. Here's what I'm looking at. I'm thinking in terms of percentage change, and that is what matters. We're now dealing with a stock that is almost $800.oo and it has big potential at earnings. I'll be honest, I never know which way a stock will move after the news. Anyone who claims they can predict that regularly needs to be scrutinized heavily. I think you take a small strangle, long and close to the money (long meaning buy the call and put, not sell).....and if you don't get a huge move, just a "little" move, say $20.00.....that should produce enough profit to offset the deep out of the money long call/put strangle. Or at least most of it. It is definitely a gamble but one worth taking. Last time Goog reported it moved about $50.00, and it was a $650.00 stock. What's that, somewhere between 7 and 9 percent? Ok, current price is around 790.......9% move is plus or minus 71 dollars. A lousy 5% move is 39.5. Good luck to everyone.

Topic.Title: Please don't be swayed by my posts from last quarter.

Message.Msg: I did not post this ....My option "suggestions" were 100% profitable last quarter with AAPL. I did not post here. WHY?...I never suggest using your own money...as a shareholder I sell longer term covered calls than play action with near term call and puts for a few dollars....This gives you a profit but not the "home run" Go back and read the posts..everything was time and dated

Message.Title: The problem was...no one understood and were confused.
Message.Msg: play the concept on paper. Watch and learn before attempting with real money
